snippet: A judge in Orange County said the prosecution had prejudiced its case against David Carlson by not allowing a grand jury to hear statements regarding aggressive movements by a rape suspect.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Judge Robert H Freehill throws out murder indictment against David Carlson, who shot and killed rape suspect Nelson Acosta-Sanchez in Sparrowbush, NY, in what prosecutors have said was vigilante killing; Westchester County district attorney's office may appeal decision.
lead_paragraph: A judge in Orange County said the prosecution had prejudiced its case against David Carlson by not allowing a grand jury to hear statements regarding aggressive movements by a rape suspect.

headline.main: New York Judge Dismisses Murder Indictment Against Man Accused of Vigilantism
headline.print_headline: Murder Indictment Upended in Vigilantism Case
